meanings.sent1: I protonate the molecule by giving it a proton.
meanings.sent2: She will protonate the solution to make it acidic.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chemist protonate the compound? To make it more reactive!
meanings.sent4: The protonation of the atom transformed it into a powerful acid.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's goal was to protonate the substance and observe its reaction.

meanings.sent1: The molecule will protonate in the presence of an acid.
meanings.sent2: When exposed to the acid, the compound will protonate quickly.
meanings.sent3: The solution seemed to protonate itself magically!
meanings.sent4: As the reaction progressed, the compound started to protonate.
meanings.sent5: The substance will protonate as soon as it interacts with the acid.
